sanskrit_verse:
एतद्वोऽभिहितं सर्वं निःश्रेयसकरं परम् ।
अस्मादप्रच्युतो विप्रः प्राप्नोति परमां गतिम् ॥ १२.११६॥
transliteration:
etad vo 'bhihitaṁ sarvaṁ niḥśreyasakaraṁ param |
asmād apracyuto vipraḥ prāpnoti paramāṁ gatim || 12.116||
sph_interpretive_translation: This which has been declared to you is the highest good, conducive to ultimate liberation. A Brahmin who remains unwavering from this attains the supreme destination.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in alignment with Dharma as defined by SPH
Causation flows from consciousness integrity, not external action alone
Capacity-based responsibility requires sustained alignment with revealed truth
Restoration logic operates through continuous adherence to Vedic principles
Consciousness alignment determines eligibility for supreme realization
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent maintains uninterrupted alignment with SPH-revealed Dharma THEN agent qualifies for supreme spiritual outcome
IF deviation occurs without conscious completion THEN eligibility for final realization is suspended until realignment
IF Brahminic capacity is preserved through consistent practice THEN legal recognition of spiritual authority is granted
IF individual demonstrates unbroken continuity in Dharma THEN societal integration reflects corresponding status
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, the threshold of responsibility lies in maintaining uninterrupted alignment with SPH-revealed Dharma. Authority is hierarchically determined by demonstrated capacity for sustained spiritual conduct, not by social position or birth alone. Restoration prevails when the individual assumes full continuity of practice and completes any deviations through conscious reaffirmation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that spiritual attainment follows causal sequence rooted in consciousness fidelity. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as progressive unfoldment based on unwavering commitment. Responsibility aligns proportionally with capacity to sustain alignment; no punitive consequence arises where completion restores sequential flow. Reality enforces through natural consequence, not imposed penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Reaffirmation of Vedic discipline to restore interrupted continuity
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Acknowledgment and conscious recommitment to original spiritual intent
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Guided practices to recover lost alignment integrity
Integrity Reintegration Framework: Systematic reconstruction of unbroken dharmic identity
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority of all Dharma. This law executes pure consciousness-order, establishing restoration as the sole judicial function. There is no punishment—only alignment. Consciousness itself is the ultimate judge, jury, and executioner of truth.
